title: MAKE ICEBORN GAUNTLET MELEE ONLY
body:
IT IS 2019. WHY DOES EZREAL STILL GET TO ABUSE THIS ITEM? 1 DAMAGE ITEM (MANAMUNE) AND A TANK ITEM, AND HE DOES MORE DAMAGE THAN ANYBODY ELSE IN THE GAME. 

Listen, Ezreal is a great champion that should award skilled players for their ability to land skill shots and use his cooldown resets properly. The fact that he can still abuse Iceborn like this to perma slow and make him a semi tank on top of everything else is just absurd. Not only ezreal, but anytime a mage top starts using this item, it immediately becomes a problem. 

Make it melee only, make it stronger for melees, buff the ranged abusers in fair ways to compensate. This is actually absurd that this needs to be said in 2019. 

Remove frozen mallet too that item is also stupid, perma slow should be a champion ability like ashe or something, not just something any old person can just buy.

replies.body: All they need to do is make the freeze zone AoE based on distance you are from your target.  They could then increase the AoE when on top of your target and reduce it to nothing at something like 700 range.  This would make the slow zone from Ezreal mean nothing if he is at a distance but be effective if he is on top of his target and buff IBG on every melee user.  Alternatively, they could also do the same thing with slow effectiveness by increasing it to 40% scaling down to 0% at longer range.

It would then slow units based on how "big" the champion is though, and I'd rather not see melee supports be punished into an Ezreal pick like that

I think big melees would welcome Ezreal not being able to slow them for full effect from a screen away.  They are easy targets so tend to get hit by skill shots.  Overall the slow would be far less than it is currently and I honestly think Ezreal would not build IBG anymore outside of full AD matchups if this change were to take place.

Wouldnt this still let him slow his primary target, which lets him continue to land Qs on them, so while it would be a nerf, it wouldnt stop him from using it.

It would slow his target only as long as they remain in the circle.  With a small circle they can quickly walk out of it and leave the slow.  It would still provide Ezreal some safety if they get to him and then he dashes away after applying the slow at close range but he wouldn't be able to permanently apply slowing fields that have a meaningful effect with my proposed change.

{{item:1031}} + {{item:3057}} = {{item:3025}}

About Ezreal abusing the item or mages abusing the item, by diminishing mana you hit them passively, but then again, the real deal is that it doesn't have "half the effect" for ranged (it would be 15%). That would solve the issue.

And as a reference, Riot removed the 35% slow from Trundle's pillar, and they changed to 15% (E level 1). And Trundle is a melee. I'm in 2 minds on this: 

On the one hand the slow zone is certainly far too strong when procced at range
On the other hand it is a viable defensive item for highly offensive champions, and that is a very narrow field of items

Ideally there could be some more 'stat stick' style defensive items that are viable on things like ADCs (think old GA, rather than 'gimmick on CD' like the new PD). Currently (at least for the ADCs) there is Maw, Iceborn or BC, and 2 of those are in dire need of a balance pass.

Well, what we really need is to get out of this ridiculous damage-meta where building any defensive item on a carry is a waste of item slot and gold efficiency...

Honestly, this is not needed at all.
Just fix Ezreal.
Mind, I love Ezreal, but he is far too powerful at basically every stage of the game with almost no way to punish him (Unless you are a certain couple of pro players that always get caught out....).
In lane, him plus any good poke support makes for a horrible laning experience and if he knows how to play late game, he can easily win the game.
They are nerfing him but I wonder if it will matter.. Considering that if he drops in win rate they will probably just hot-fix buff him since he is so popular.

Ezreal and Yasuo: Why we can't have nice things.

(And perhaps Tryndamere and Master Yi and Vayne)
